The puzzles are incredibly good, the whole plot is awesome and we can see in the small details the hard work of the developers. Nothing was in the game for mere chance, eiter the music or a simple dialogue, and the humor was well achieved. I found the game and its story completely unpredictable and that was simply amazing. It is certainly one of the best games I've ever played and it is worth the money. 
The cooperation mode is equally very enjoyable and assures some hours of fun with friends.
I definitely recommend it!

Now, I know I am extremely late to the party and technically speaking have only completed half the game (achievement wise anyway). I just completed my first single player play through. In 2019 I might add. This game has aged remarkably well and I beg of anyone who might have any hesitancy to buy this, please do. It is amazing and has stood the test of time. My only gripe with the game is that sometimes the solutions to some puzzles are just to scour every inch of space you can see for a portal placement spot .  That alone is my only gripe. Otherwise fantastic game that I highly recommend. :)

ilk oyundan sonra 1 e 1000 katılarak yapılan ikinci oyun karşınızda.klasik valve ikilemeleri efsanelerinden biridir.bazı yerlerde kafanızı iyi çalıştırmalı ve gözlerinizi dört açmalısınız.ilk oyun incelememdede söylediğim gibi.eğer IQ nuz düşük,gerizekalı,mongol veya beyin özürlü iseniz hiç başlamayın.size göre değil.bu oyun zeki olupta zekasını katlamak isteyenler için yapılmış bir oyun.şimdi diyeceksinizki neden böyle aşağılıyorsun milleti.kendin çokmu zekisin.evet efendim zekiyim.121 IQ yum.ve bu mükemmel oyunun altında saçma salak yorumlar görmek istemediğim içinde böyle diyorum.ilk oyunun sonunda çalan şarkı güzeldi.bunun kini pek beğenmedim.

9/10

Better than the first part in every way. I'm a huge fan of the Portal series. I remember when The Orange Box came out I bought it just so I could play Portal. After I graduated high school, Portal 2 came out and I never got around to playing it until now (8 years later). What immediately captured my attention is how well the story is told. The environment is very immersive and the puzzles are just the right amount of challenge. My only complaint was that game has SO many plot twists that I got frustrated a few times when I was certain that I had reached the end of the game. I would love to explore the co-op mode and a few of the community builds, but I should clear out my backlog before I get around to that. I got this game on sale (for $1?) and for the price, this is a must have for any collection.
